title: After Narrow Loss In 2012, GOP's Mia Love Finds New Strength In Utah
teaser: Mia Love is running again in Utah's 4th Congressional District after losing to Democrat Jim Matheson in 2012 by just 768 votes. With Matheson retiring, Love is now the front-runner. If elected, she'd be the first black female Republican elected to Congress.
contentencoded: Copyright 2014 NPR. To see more, visit http://www.npr.org/.
